snippet: I once had a quite substantial Afro. But it is not healthy for you when your hair becomes a “thing.”
abstract: Op-Ed article by writer and editor Bruce Handy recalls having a quite substantial Afro in the 1970s, referencing Bill de Blasio's son Dante and his Afro figuring so heavily in the New York City mayoral election; warns Dante that it is not healthy for one's hair to become one's defining characteristic.
lead_paragraph: I once had a quite substantial Afro. But it is not healthy for you when your hair becomes a “thing.”
